title.narrative: F.a: Strengthening the quality of education in Uganda?s education sector

description.narrative: Lyantonde district grapples with several development challenges, including related to the quality education. Many children in Lyantonde are denied their rights including the right to basic education. Out of over 18,000 children (8,750 Boys; 9,310 girls) in the district enrolled in school, only 57% complete as compared to 67% nationally . This has resulted into persistent poor quality of education associated with poor quality grades, low enrollment in secondary and tertiary institutions, un skilled populatio n faced with acute unemployment and finally low quality of life. The project intervention shall contribute towards mobilizing and enhancing the capacity of communities, parents, teachers, pupils, CCTs and local leaders to participate in planning, implement ing and monitoring the delivery of education services. The main objective of the project is to strengthen the capacity of citizens (parents, pupils and civil society organizations to foster increased collaboration with duty bearers for improved quality of education in Lyantonde district.Expected results:? Improved community participation to promote access to quality education service delivery ? Strengthened local accountability platform for continuous dialogue between rights holders and duty bearers? Child friendly school environment for quality and inclusive education promotedRight-holders/ beneficiaries: The primary target includes school going children (6-18).The duty bearers include District Education Officials, parents and guardians of the targeted chil drenImplementing partner: Rural Action Community Based Organization (RACOBAO)
